camel.source.path.host.name: camel.source.path.host
camel.source.path.host.description: Name of the javax.jcr.Repository to lookup from the Camel registry to be used.

camel.source.path.base.name: camel.source.path.base
camel.source.path.base.description: Get the base node when accessing the repository

camel.source.endpoint.deep.name: camel.source.endpoint.deep
camel.source.endpoint.deep.description: When isDeep is true, events whose associated parent node is at absPath or within its subgraph are received.

camel.source.endpoint.eventTypes.name: camel.source.endpoint.eventTypes
camel.source.endpoint.eventTypes.description: eventTypes (a combination of one or more event types encoded as a bit mask value such as javax.jcr.observation.Event.NODE_ADDED, javax.jcr.observation.Event.NODE_REMOVED, etc.).

camel.source.endpoint.nodeTypeNames.name: camel.source.endpoint.nodeTypeNames
camel.source.endpoint.nodeTypeNames.description: When a comma separated nodeTypeName list string is set, only events whose associated parent node has one of the node types (or a subtype of one of the node types) in this list will be received.

camel.source.endpoint.noLocal.name: camel.source.endpoint.noLocal
camel.source.endpoint.noLocal.description: If noLocal is true, then events generated by the session through which the listener was registered are ignored. Otherwise, they are not ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.sessionLiveCheckIn.name: camel.source.endpoint.sessionLiveCheckInterval
camel.source.endpoint.sessionLiveCheckIn.description: Interval in milliseconds to wait before each session live checking The default value is 60000 ms.

camel.source.endpoint.sessionLiveCheckIn.name: camel.source.endpoint.sessionLiveCheckIntervalOnStart
camel.source.endpoint.sessionLiveCheckIn.description: Interval in milliseconds to wait before the first session live checking. The default value is 3000 ms.

camel.source.endpoint.uuids.name: camel.source.endpoint.uuids
camel.source.endpoint.uuids.description: When a comma separated uuid list string is set, only events whose associated parent node has one of the identifiers in the comma separated uuid list will be received.

camel.source.endpoint.workspaceName.name: camel.source.endpoint.workspaceName
camel.source.endpoint.workspaceName.description: The workspace to access. If it's not specified then the default one will be used

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.name: camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.jcr.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.component.jcr.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.jcr.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.jcr.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.component.jcr.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.jcr.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities
